Example

For the following list of experiments, list (if possible) a suitable sample space. If you cannot write out a suitable sample space, describe one in words.

  1. Test a light switch
  2. Count the daily traffic accidents in Loughborough involving cyclists
  3. Measure the tensile strength of small gauge steel wire
  4. Test the maximum current carrying capacity of household mains cabling
  5. Test the number of on-off switchings that a new type of fluorescent tube will cope with before failure
  6. Pressure test an underwater TV camera.

Solution

Sample spaces might be

  1. \(\{\)works, fails\(\}\)
  2. \(\{0,1, 2, 3, \dots \}\), hopefully a small upper limit!
  3. \(\{\) Positive continuous range \((0, \infty)\)\(\}\) or \(\{\)Suitable bounded continuous interval depending on the wire or measuring device\(\}\)
  4. \(\{\) Positive continuous range \((0, \infty)\)\(\}\) or \(\{\)Suitable bounded continuous range depending on the type of cable\(\}\)
  5. \(\{0,1, 2, 3, \dots\}\), hopefully a high upper limit!
  6. \(\{\) Positive continuous range \((0, \infty)\)\(\}\) or \(\{\)Suitable bounded continuous interval\(\}\)
